main

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to the gameboard and the player list, as well as running general game settings. This object will act as an observer which updates each of the Players with their next moves, and retrieves information from the Players for use in the UI. This Object also resets the gameboard.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private GameBoard board
      The GameBoard containing attributes and methods relating to the board size.
      private PlayerList players
      The PlayerList object controlling all the players for the game.
      static int STEPSIZE
      The number of units moved by a turtle in each step.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(int canvasWidth,
                      int canvasHeight)
        Create a new GameController object with a GameBoard of the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        canvasWidth - The width of the GameBoard
        canvasHeight - The height of the GameBoard

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayers

        public PlayerList getPlayers()
        Returns:
        PlayerList for game

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> getObjects()
        Function that returns all objects following a step of the game. This function updates the turtle locations, and lines, before getting all objects controlled by each player and returning them all.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of GameObjects, corresponding to all the GameObjects in play.

      • checkLose

        public Player checkLose()
        For all players, go through and see if the player has lost. A player "loses" if they get within 1/2 of a step size of another player's turtle or line.
        Returns:
        Losing Player if there has been a loss, null otherwise.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Reset all players back to initial positions, and remove all lines.

      • checkObjectLocation

        public boolean checkObjectLocation(GameObject obj)
        Given a GameObject, check to see if the object is past the bounds of the gameboard. If it is, set the location back to the bounds of the object, and reverse the orientation, creating a "bouncing" effect
        Parameters:
        obj - GameObject which will be tested for location errors
        Returns:
        True if the object was past the bounds, and false otherwise.
